identificationModule.briefTitle: Remote Pregnancy Monitoring to Improve Access
identificationModule.officialTitle: Remote Pregnancy Monitoring to Improve Access: The REACTIVE Trial

collaborators.name: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The goal of this clinical trial is to determine the effectiveness of remote nonstress test (NST) compared to in-clinic NSTs in improving fetal testing completion rates. Participants will be randomized to either in-clinic NSTs or use of an FDA-approved remote monitoring belt for their pregnancy monitoring.

interventions.name: Invu monitoring belt
interventions.description: INVU monitoring belt used for remote NSTs

primaryOutcomes.description: percentage of recommended antenatal testing sessions that were successfully completed as defined as a clinically interpreted test was performed
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Testing Completion Rate in Black versus non-Black subjects
primaryOutcomes.description: Comparison between Black and non-Black subjects' percentage of recommended antenatal testing sessions that were successfully completed as defined as a clinically interpreted test was performed.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Number of visits to the antenatal testing unit
secondaryOutcomes.description: Count of visits to the office for in-person monitoring
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Frequency of provider recommended prolonged monitoring
secondaryOutcomes.description: Count of number of times provider recommends prolonged monitoring (defined by greater than 40 minutes of time on the monitor).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Time on NST monitor
secondaryOutcomes.description: Sum of the number of minutes the subject is on the NST monitor
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Number of non-reactive NSTs
secondaryOutcomes.description: Count of the number of visits
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Number of biophysical profiles performed for non-reactive NST tests
secondaryOutcomes.description: Count of the number of biophysical profiles performed for non-reactive NST visits
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Overall number of visits to the obstetrical triage unit
secondaryOutcomes.description: Count of the number of visits to the obstetrical triage unit
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Overall number of visits to the obstetrical triage unit directly related to a fetal monitoring visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: Count of the number of visit directly related to an outpatient fetal monitoring appointment or session
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Frequency of recommendation for delivery based on findings on fetal monitoring result
secondaryOutcomes.description: Count of the number of subjects in each arm who receive a recommendation for delivery based on the findings of the fetal monitoring results.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fetal Monitoring outcomes: Number of times a NST is not completed within the prescribed window
secondaryOutcomes.description: Count of number of NSTs which occur outside of prescribed window, for example, if a weekly testing regimen is prescribed, an appointment 8 or more days following the last one would count as 1 missed calendar window.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks gestational age to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Gestational age at delivery
secondaryOutcomes.description: gestational age at time of delivery
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: time of delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Number of participants with Preterm delivery
secondaryOutcomes.description: preterm delivery is defined as less than 37 weeks gestational age
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: time of delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Mode of delivery
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: time of delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Number of participants with an Indication for labor induction
secondaryOutcomes.description: in subjects who have labor induction, indication for inducing labor
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: time of labor induction

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Number of participants with an Indication for cesarean section
secondaryOutcomes.description: in subjects who have a cesarean section delivery, indication for cesarean section
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: time of delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Composite neonatal morbidity score
secondaryOutcomes.description: Composite score of neonatal morbidity comprised of one or more of the following: severe respiratory distress, neonatal resuscitation outside of the delivery room, and death. This score could range from 0 to 3 with a higher score meaning a worse outcome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from delivery to 6 weeks post-delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Neonatal cord blood pH
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: time of delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Apgar scores
secondaryOutcomes.description: Apgar score at five and ten minutes after delivery, the score ranges from 0 to 10 with a higher score meaning a better outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: five and ten minutes after delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Number of participants with an Admission to the neonatal intensive care unit
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from delivery to 6 weeks post-delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Admission to the neonatal intensive care unit for greater than 48 hours
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from delivery to 6 weeks post-delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Maternal length of stay
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from delivery to discharge, up to 6 weeks post-delivery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetrics outcomes: Neonatal length of stay
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from birth to discharge, up to 6 weeks after birth

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Cost-effectiveness outcomes: Productivity loss survey
secondaryOutcomes.description: This survey will collect in half days increments the productivity impacts of the pregnancy, NSTs and for seeking health care for those reasons
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at three timepoints, at time of randomization, 3 weeks after randomization (plus or minus 1 week) and 5 weeks after randomization (plus or minus 1 week)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Cost-effectiveness outcomes: Costs
secondaryOutcomes.description: Costs will be estimated based on collection of data on all health care visits, including outpatient, ED, OB triage and hospital admissions
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from 32 weeks to delivery, average of 10 weeks after enrollment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Implementation outcomes: Theory-informed Acceptability Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: 8-item Likert scale with range of values from 8 to 40 with a high score being more acceptable.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at time of delivery

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Singleton pregnancy
* Gestational age between 30 weeks 0 days and 35 weeks 6 days
* Pregnant patients who have clinical indication for fetal surveillance with NSTs (based on UPHS Health System clinical guidelines for antenatal monitoring)
* Able to provide written consent
* English speaking

Exclusion Criteria:

* Multiple gestations
* Maternal pre-gravid BMI greater than 45kg/m2
* Presence of an implanted pacemaker or defibrillator
* Active abdominal skin infection
* A known amniotic fluid index (AFI) less than 5cm or greater than 25cm on the most recent ultrasound (if available) prior to randomization
* Delivery is planned within 2 weeks of potential randomization
